Package neureka.autograd

Interface ADAgent

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultADAgent
public interface ADAgent
ADAgent stands for "Auto-Differentiation-Agent", meaning that implementations of this class are responsible for managing forward- and reverse- mode differentiation actions. These actions are accessible through the "forward(...)" and "backward(...)" method which are being triggered by instances of the GraphNode class during propagation.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    <T> Tsr<T> backward​(GraphNode<T> target, Tsr<T> error)
    The auto-differentiation backward pass of an ADAgent propagates error values backward along the computation graph.
    Tsr<?> derivative()  
    <T> Tsr<T> forward​(GraphNode<T> target, Tsr<T> derivative)
    The auto-differentiation forward pass of an ADAgent propagate partial differentiations forward along the computation graph.
    boolean hasBackward()  
    boolean hasForward()  
    java.lang.String toString()  

  • Method Details

    • forward

      <T> Tsr<T> forward​(GraphNode<T> target, Tsr<T> derivative)
      The auto-differentiation forward pass of an ADAgent propagate partial differentiations forward along the computation graph.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type argument of the tensor that is being used.
      Parameters:
      target - The node which is targeted to hold the partial derivative.
      derivative - The partial derivative which ought to be propagated forward.
      Returns:
      The result of a forward mode auto differentiation.

    • backward

      <T> Tsr<T> backward​(GraphNode<T> target, Tsr<T> error)
      The auto-differentiation backward pass of an ADAgent propagates error values backward along the computation graph.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type argument of the tensor that is being used.
      Parameters:
      target - The node which is targeted to hold the new error.
      error - The error which ought to be propagated backward.
      Returns:
      The result of a backward mode auto differentiation, and new error for the targeted graph node.

    • derivative

      Tsr<?> derivative()
      Returns:
      A partial derivative or null if the agent does not contain a partial derivative...

      boolean hasForward()

    • hasBackward

      boolean hasBackward()

    • toString

      java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
